Can French PM Lecornu succeed where his predecessors failed?
subhead: Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu is seeking to restore trust with labor unions, employers' organizations, and the opposition Socialists. But he is yet to address the sensitive topic of the budget, observes Le Monde's Nathalie Segaunes in her column.

subhead: In an op-ed for Le Monde, historian Gaëtan Thomas warns of the dangerous passivity of checks and balances in the US in the face of public health decisions made by Donald Trump's administration.

headline: Vivian Jenna Wilson, Elon Musk's transgender daughter, has become a New York Fashion Week sensation
subhead: The billionaire's daughter, who is transgender and estranged from her father, made a splash during New York Fashion Week in mid-September. At 21, her rising profile and outspoken positions have become a source of encouragement for a community that has faced adversity under the Trump administration.

headline: At Musée d'Orsay, John Singer Sargent, an American in Paris
subhead: While revered by major museums internationally, the painter remains little known in France. Focusing on his Paris years, his first exhibition seeks to correct that oversight.

headline: Relationship sex: Why many women still feel pressure to say yes
subhead: Many women have sex with their partners even when they do not want to, out of reluctance to say no, uncertainty about desire, or fear of offending. Together, these reasons sketch the contours of a gray zone of consent.

subhead: The right pretends not to see that the ultra-rich are not paying their fair share. The left, meanwhile, is blindly accepting an idea that is solely academic in nature, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

headline: In Italy, tens of thousands hold protests in solidarity with Gaza
subhead: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets across Italy on Monday to 'condemn the genocide in Gaza,' during a day of protests marked by strikes and blockades organized by several unions, echoing the slogan of the French protest movement, Block Everything.

headline: How Israel tried to halt the wave of recognition of the State of Palestine
subhead: Emmanuel Macron is set to deliver his speech recognizing Palestine on September 22 at the UN headquarters in New York. In retaliation, Israel is considering closing the French consulate in Jerusalem and annexing part of the West Bank.
